content.description: Easy ramp to dirty crack used to access anchors of dippin dots to the left. Included here just to explain the extra bolts
content.protection: 3 bolts - kind of spaced out but easy terrain
content.location: Right of dippin dots, finishes at the same anchors

content.description: Climb a few face moves to the 1st bolt, then follow a left leaning intrusion to a sloping ledge at the base of a left facing flared chimney. Clip the bolt at the mouth of the chimney and jump on in for some awkward fun! Ends on a small ledge
content.protection: 9 bolts, 3 bolt anchor (a big crystal chipped off under the right-most bolt while installing it, a 3rd bolt was added to back this up)
content.location: Midway on the north face of the DLK dome, about 70 ft right of "a dike runs through it"

content.description: Follow the intrusion just left of an orange water streak until it heads into a right facing corner joining a second somewhat more fragile intrusion. Have your belayer wear a helmet since some of the big rocks in the intrusion are loose!
content.location: North face of DLK dome, across the small gully from Spinal Tap on the Plasma Dome

climbs.name: A Dike Runs Through It
climbs.fa: Randy Kieliszewski, Steve Habovstack, Frank Dolana, and Jamie Mueller, August 1994

content.description: Short sport route that runs up a rusty colored intrusion on the northeast face of DLK dome. Fun side-pulling up to a small overhang. The first bolt is high and past a tricky start so a stick clip is recommended if you're not confident at the grade
content.protection: QDs for bolts, two bolt anchor
content.location: Northeast face of DLK dome. Look for the rust colored intrusion that creates an obvious right facing edge
